page.title: 13POST OFFICES
page.content:
{ LEIGH POST OFFICE The present Post Office has been in existence for 23 years and prior to that was situated at what is now the Old Post House. Leigh Post Office is one of the few remaining offices in the district which still has mail sent from the G.P.O. for sorting and delivery. The postmistress collects the outgoing mail twice daily from the post box outside. There is also a telephone kiosk.
On average forty people a day use the post office, forty-eight people collect retirement pensions and twenty -eight mothers collect family allow- ances each week.
The Post Office is housed in a cottage which has been in the family for over a hundred years.
